Sentencas: In this study, the impact of ink rheology on the properties of screen-printed nickel/scandia-stabilized-zirconia anodes was investigated.
Titulo: The impact of ink rheology on the properties of screen-printed solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: From the rheological tests, terpineol and texanol inks with 1-3 wt% binder were suitable for screen-printing at the applied screen-printing condition, and hence these inks were used to study their rheological impact on the properties of resultant films.
Titulo: The impact of ink rheology on the properties of screen-printed solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: The mechanical hardness of anode films increased with binder content.
Titulo: The impact of ink rheology on the properties of screen-printed solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: Moreover, the electronic conductivity and electrode polarization resistance of the reduced films increased and decreased, respectively, with increasing binder content.
Titulo: The impact of ink rheology on the properties of screen-printed solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: The improved film properties can be related to the increased particle network strength within the inks, leading to improved film microstructures for application as SOFC anodes.
Titulo: The impact of ink rheology on the properties of screen-printed solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: The study also confirmed that the properties of films were more significantly affected by the binder content than solvent type, which had only a minor effect.
Titulo: The impact of ink rheology on the properties of screen-printed solid oxide fuel cell anodes

Sentencas: Overall, from the perspective of ink rheology, screen-printability and performance, an ink with 3 wt% binder gave the best performance at the applied screen-printing condition.
Titulo: The impact of ink rheology on the properties of screen-printed solid oxide fuel cell anodes
